alert.note: Alert for Caddo (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 12:22PM CST until January 27 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Cross Bayou At Cross Lake affecting Caddo Parish. For the Lakes...including Cross Lake...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cross Bayou at Cross Lake. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Secondary roads and camps in an around Cross Lake could see impacts from rising water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 172.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 172.5 feet. - Forecast...The lake is currently at a flat crest, but additional rises are possible this weekend due to expected rainfall overnight. A slow fall will commence by the start of next week. - Action stage is 172.5 feet. - Flood stage is 173.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 200 PM CST.
